TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerSerializerAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class DesignerSerializerAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class DesignerSerializerAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Indicates a serializer for the serialization manager to use to serialize the values of the type this attribute is applied to. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializerAttribute> provides a way to indicate to the designer serialization manager that a specific type of serializer should be used when serializing the values of an object. This allows you to specify a serializer that is capable of serializing a custom type, for instance. Place this attribute on a class to indicate the serialization object to use when serializing the class.
## Examples The following code uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializerAttribute> to associate an example serializer with an example component.
[!code-cpp[DesignerSerializerAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerSerializerAttribute/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DesignerSerializerAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerSerializerAttribute/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DesignerSerializerAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerSerializerAttribute/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.param: The fully qualified name of the data type of the serializer.
The fully qualified name of the base data type of the serializer. Multiple serializers can be supplied for a class as long as the serializers have different base types.

Docs.summary: Indicates a unique ID for this attribute type.
Docs.value: A unique ID for this attribute type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This ID is used by filtering algorithms to identify two attributes that are the same type. For most attributes, this just returns the <xref:System.Type> instance for the attribute. <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> overrides this to include the type of the editor base type.
